article.headline: St. Bonaventure 79, Savannah St. 47
article.story: OLEAN, N.Y. -- Andrew Nicholson scored 18 points, leading four St. Bonaventure players in double figures in a 79-47 rout of Savannah State on Saturday night. Malcolm Eleby and Jonathan Hall added 11 points apiece for the Bonnies (6-3), and Demitrius Conger chipped in with a career-high 10. The Bonnies got going early and led the Tigers (4-6) by 13 points at the half. St. Bonaventure outscored Savannah State 44-25 in the second to seal the win. St. Bonaventure, which also sank 27 free throws, shot 53.3 percent from the field (24-for-45) in the game compared to just a 34.7 mark (17-for-49) for the Tigers. The Bonnies were 4 of 9 from beyond the arc, while Savannah State hit just 2 of 12. Tracy Rankins paced the Tigers with 11 points. St. Bonaventure has held three opponents under 50 points already this season, a feat last accomplished by the 1981-82 team.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
